titlestmt.titleproper: Preliminary Guide to the Nahanni Productions Archive
titlestmt.author: Compiled by Maria Zapata

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Monday April 29, 2019 at 23:00

did.abstract: The archive contains materials that document the photography and bookworks by Pat and Rosemarie Keough, who are the proprietors of Nahanni Productions. The archive includes process materials relating to individual book projects as well as correspondence and other research materials.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of Pat and Rosemarie Keough, 2013, 2014.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright has not been transferred to Yale University.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Nahanni Productions Archive, Robert B. Haas Family Arts Library, Yale University.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Pat and Rosemarie Keough are fine art photographers and private press publishers. Much of their photographic work focuses on environmental and social causes. As proprietors of Nahanni Productions Inc., the Keoughs oversee every element of book production, as exemplified by their limited edition Explorer Series.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The archive contains materials that document the photography and bookworks by Pat and Rosemarie Keough, including process materials relating to individual book projects as well as correspondence and other research and promotional materials.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into five series: I. Biographical. II. Correspondence. III. Publicity. IV. Book Projects. V. Additional Research Materials.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series I contains examples of Rosemarie's early books, such as journals and other childhood ephemera.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Materials are generally grouped by project title.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series IV contains process materials, marketing materials, and correspondence related to various book projects by Pat and Rosemarie Keough / Nahanni Productions. These projects include: Nahanni Portfolio , The Niagara Escarpment: A Portfolio , Beautiful Arnprior , Ottawa Valley Portfolio , Wild and Beautiful Sable Island , The Beauty of Renfrew and Area , Nova Scotia Portfolio , Antarctica , and Labyrinth Sublime .
Individual catalog records for the Keoughs' published works can also be found in Orbis.

scopecontent.p: Includes two die tests of engraving styles and the Antarctica front cover die (design by P&R Keough, engraving by Frank Bonigut Engraving Limited).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: These materials document the Keoughs' search for a strong binding structure suitable for their weighty, limited edition Explorer Series project. The Keoughs solicited prototypes from the following bookbinders: Harcourt Bindery in Boston, MA; Roswell Bookbinding in Phoenix, AZ; and Felton Bookbinding in Georgetown, Ontario. The Keoughs ultimately worked with Keith Felton, who developed a custom binding for Antarctica by combining the techniques of a classic European leather binding and a split-board ledger binding.

In addition to the iterative prototypes or "dummies" for Antarctica , each box contains typewritten specifications and subsequent evaluations by the Keoughs. For more detailed Antarctica production notes, see also Box 12.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This is an actual case for Antarctica , which shows the cover design as well as the splits in the interior boards.
